channel.title: Articles by Eli Roy on Tech Terminologies
channel.description: Recent content in Articles by Eli Roy on Tech Terminologies

item.title: What is QoS (Quality of Service)?
item.description: Quality of Service (QoS) refers to the capability of a network to provide better service to selected network traffic over various technologies.

item.title: What is an IP subnet-based VLAN (Virtual Local Area Network)?
item.description: An IP subnet-based VLAN is a type of virtual LAN (VLAN) that is created based on the IP subnet of the hosts.

item.title: What is a Trunk Port?
item.description: A trunk port is a network port that is capable of carrying traffic for multiple VLANs (Virtual Local Area Networks).

item.title: What is a File Extension?
item.description: A file extension is a set of characters that is added to the end of a file name and helps to identify the type of file.

item.title: What is E2EE (End-to-end encryption)?
item.description: End-to-end encryption (E2EE) is a method of transmitting data where only the sender and the intended recipient can read the messages.

item.title: What is PowerShell?
item.description: PowerShell is a task automation and configuration management framework developed by Microsoft, consisting of a command-line shell and an associated scripting language.

item.title: What is SATA (Serial ATA)?
item.description: Serial ATA (SATA) is a computer bus interface that connects host bus adapters to mass storage devices such as hard drives and optical drives.

item.title: What is a Desktop Computer?
item.description: A desktop computer is a personal computer that is designed to be used on a desk or tabletop, as opposed to being portable like a laptop or handheld device.

item.title: What is an Open Format?
item.description: An open format is a file format that is openly licensed and publicly available for anyone to use and implement.

item.title: What is Compression (Data Compression)?
item.description: Data compression is a technique used to represent data in a more compact form in order to reduce the amount of storage space required or to transmit the data more efficiently over a network.

item.title: What is a Keylogger?
item.description: A keylogger, also known as a keystroke logger or keyboard logger, is a type of software or hardware that tracks and records every keystroke made on a computer’s keyboard.

item.title: What is an Installer?
item.description: An installer is a software application that is used to install, update, and configure a computer program or software package.

item.title: What is a Build?
item.description: A build (also known as a “build process”) is the process of transforming source code into a stand-alone, executable form that can be run on a computer or other device.

item.title: What is a Meme?
item.description: A meme is a piece of information, idea, or behavior that spreads from person to person within a culture.

item.title: What is a Datagram?
item.description: A “datagram” is a self-contained, independent entity of data carrying sufficient information to be routed from the source to the destination computer without reliance on earlier exchanges between the source and destination computers and the transporting network.

item.title: What is the 404 Error (Not Found)?
item.description: The 404 error is an HTTP (Hypertext Transfer Protocol) status code that indicates that the server was unable to find the requested resource.

item.title: What is UPS (Uninterruptible Power Supply)?
item.description: An uninterruptible power supply (UPS) is a device that provides backup power to a computer, server, or other electronic equipment in the event of an interruption or fluctuation in the main power supply.

item.title: What is ICT (Information and Communications Technology)?
item.description: Information and communications technology, or ICT, refers to the various technologies and tools used to facilitate the exchange of information and communication.

item.title: What is Image Scaling?
item.description: Image scaling refers to the process of resizing an image. This can be done for a variety of reasons, such as to fit an image into a specific space on a webpage or to reduce the file size of an image to make it easier to upload or download.

item.title: What is a Serial Number?
item.description: A serial number is a unique identification number or code that is used to activate a software application.

item.title: What is an Activation Key?
item.description: An activation key, also known as a serial number or license key, is a unique code that is used to register or activate a software application.

item.title: What is a Base Station?
item.description: A base station is a device that serves as a central hub for wireless communication in a local area network (LAN).
